args.natural_language_statement: Suppose f : I → ℝ is differentiable at c ∈ I. Prove that there exist real numbers a and b such that for every ε > 0 there exists δ > 0 with |a + b (x - c) - f x| ≤ ε |x - c| whenever x ∈ I and |x - c| < δ. Equivalently, prove that there exists a function g : I → ℝ with lim_{x→c} g(x) = 0 and |a + b (x - c) - f x| = |x - c| g(x) for all x ∈ I near c.
